name: Kansas City Chorale
missionStatement: As a cornerstone of the Kansas City performing arts community, the Chorale creates concert programs and recordings that educate, engage, provoke, and inspire listeners. The Chorale’s ongoing outreach efforts facilitate the development of local talent, while providing students and their instructors with the opportunity to learn from world-class vocalists.

name: Spire Chamber Ensemble
missionStatement: Spire Chamber Ensemble inspires, educates, and enriches the Kansas City metropolitan community through the transformational power of choral music performed at the highest artistic level.

name: Kantorei of Kansas City
missionStatement: Kantorei's mission is to educate audiences, enrich lives, build community and bring vitality to past and present through music of the highest professional quality.

name: Te Deum
missionStatement: Te Deum's mission is to perform a diverse sacred choral repertoire in a uniquely relevant context, to create a musically inspiring, spiritually stirring experience.

name: KC VITAs
missionStatement: Standing for the Kansas City Vibrating Internal Thyroarytenoids, KC VITAs is a group of professional singers with the mission to promote the continued creation and performance of “contemporary-classical” vocal music. The choir is committed to performing new music, benefitting composers and performers alike.

name: Central Standard
missionStatement: Central Standard is a culturally diverse and inclusive a cappella ensemble for lower voices that embodies the spirit of camaraderie. Central Standard is dedicated to enriching lives through performing with musical excellence and encouraging music appreciation in schools and the community.

name: Vocal Standard
missionStatement: Vocal Standard is committed to creating music in an uplifting environment that fosters creativity, support, belonging, and joy.

name: Heartland Men's Chorus Kansas City
missionStatement: Heartland Men’s Chorus Kansas City’s mission is to build community, celebrate pride, and empower authenticity. The members of HMCKC have joined together for the purpose of making music as a not-for-profit, volunteer chorus of LBGTQ+ and allies who are making a positive cultural contribution through musical excellence.

name: Kansas City Women's Chorus
missionStatement: The Kansas City Women’s Chorus is a catalyst for change, pushing ourselves and our audiences beyond what is thought possible. Simply singing is not enough.

name: The Choral Foundation
missionStatement: Many Songs. Many Voices. Music For The Human Grace.

name: William Jewell College
missionStatement: William Jewell College educates their community to ask reflective questions, apply critical thought and act with purpose.

name: Kansas City Symphony
missionStatement: The Kansas City Symphony aims to increase the desirability of classical music throughout the community by taking an experiential approach to concerts.

name: Black Musical Arts Community Choir of Kansas City
missionStatement: The Black Musical Arts Community Choir of Kansas city is a newly formed organization committed to showcasing classically trained African-American musical artists including vocalists, instrumentalists, and composers.

name: Musica Vocale
missionStatement: Uniting friends – singers, instrumentalists and audiences – in exceptional experiences of choral music.

name: Notorious Chorus
missionStatement: Gain confidence in your voice and experience the JOY of singing in harmony with others.

name: Choral Spectrum
missionStatement: Choral Spectrum's mission is to provide a safe place of inclusion and expression to all LGBTQIA and Allies in our community using the power of music to enrich lives and influence our acceptance by all who listen.

name: Midwest Chamber Ensemble
missionStatement: The Midwest Chamber Ensemble is a Kansas City-based 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to the performance of Chamber Orchestra and Chamber Ensemble music of the classical tradition with the goal of providing a space for early career professionals and music students to have the opportunity to perform chamber works outside of an educational setting.

name: The Shanty Choir
missionStatement: The Shanty Choir's mission is to provide a space to gather safely, sing freely, and connect with each other in our community.

name: Liberty Community Chorus
missionStatement: Founded in 2003, the Liberty Community Chorus is an 80-voice chorus open to singers 16 years of age and older. The Chorus consists of non-auditioned singers from throughout the greater Kansas City area who prepare, rehearse and perform stunning modern and ancient choral works from the world’s great composers.

name: Northland Community Choir
missionStatement: Northland Community Choir is committed to providing a place for people to come together to sing and to appreciate quality choral music. NCC is a choral ensemble whose members cultivate an environment of learning and growth in an atmosphere of sharing and acceptance. The choir’s purpose is to enrich the spirit, musical appreciation, and well-being of its members and the community-at-large.

name: Kansas City Medical Arts Symphony
missionStatement: Since its founding, the Symphony has not wavered from its dual mission of providing an opportunity for amateur musicians to perform great works of Western music and enriching the cultural life of Kansas City by presenting free concerts, including premier performances of works by local composers.

name: Songflower Chorale
missionStatement: A choral ensemble dedicated to fine presentations of high-quality music, old and new,  to enlighten, to inspire, and to beautify the Kansas City area. We are committed to promoting love, understanding, peace, and community through the choral art.

name: University of Missouri-Kansas City
missionStatement: Each of the Conservatory choral ensembles is guided by a philosophy that seeks to engage its students and audiences to diverse choral repertoire – featuring great choral masterworks and music written by living composers. The UMKC choral area is committed to programming works by underrepresented composers including women and BIPOC composers.

name: Avila University
missionStatement: Avila students are creative, involved, and passionate. On-campus you’ll find a culture that provides the freedom to embrace your individuality, while also giving you exceptional support and opportunities to express yourself.

name: Kansas City Kansas Community College
missionStatement: The primary objective of the Choral Music Program at KCKCC is to educate the students and the community about vocal ensemble music through stylistic variety and tonal diversity, based on historical precedent. This objective is achieved by exposing choir members to music of different nationalities and/or cultures and their commitment to recreate a unique tone quality that identifies with the cultural environment of each composition.

name: Johnson County Community College
missionStatement: The chorus sings a wide variety of choral literature, from master works to contemporary selections.

name: Allegro Choirs of Kansas City
missionStatement: Allegro connects young singers to music, to each other, and to the world.  Allegro is dedicated to enriching, inspiring, and transforming the lives of young singers through excellence in leadership, confidence-building, and team work braided with extraordinary instruction and performance opportunities.

name: Youth Chorus of Kansas City
missionStatement: YCKC's mission is to teach, to inspire, and to empower young singers to be life-long music makers who seek excellence in everything they do.

name: Kansas City Boys Choir and Girls Choir
missionStatement: The organization's mission is to provide a communication style for youth that crosses socioeconomic, gender and ethnic barriers to open portals of creativity through teaching music arts education and performance.

name: Music/Arts Institute
missionStatement: Music/Arts Institute is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization committed to helping all young artists access the training and opportunities they need to advance their passion.

name: Kansas City A Cappella
missionStatement: Kansas City A Cappella is dedicated to providing a unique educational and musical experience for high school students around the Kansas City Metropolitan area. This organization houses the contemporary vocal a cappella group, Sound Proof, in which the members of the ensemble are introduced to the world of vocal a cappella and given the opportunity to grow as performers, vocalists, and musicians.

name: Lawrence Children's Choir
missionStatement: The Lawrence Children’s Choir nurtures the personal and musical growth of our singers, elevates skill through professional-level musical training, and ignites passion through unparalleled experiences and a community with a shared love for life-long singing.

name: Resurrection, A United Methodist Church
missionStatement: Music is an important part of our worship. At Resurrection, we have several different styles of music and a variety of ways for musicians to get involved.

name: Stage Right Performing Arts
missionStatement: Stage Right's mission has been simple - to keep quality music and theater in the lives of all our children, all year long.

name: EncoreKC! Foundation
missionStatement: The Foundation's mission is to promote community appreciation for the arts through an accessible artistic environment for adults over the age of 50, regardless of experience or ability, who seek arts education in a musical environment through community outreach and performance.

name: Rockhurst University
missionStatement: The Center for Arts & Letters is a hub for presenting cultural events and experiences that make multi-disciplinary connections across the Rockhurst campus and greater Kansas City. Our objective is to engage audiences with thoughtful, intellectually engaging, and socially relevant issues through liberal arts experiences to inspire cura personalis — “care for the whole person,” foster social action through contemplation and deepen appreciation for all expressions of human thought and culture.

name: Kansas City Chorus
missionStatement: The Kansas City Chorus is an innovative and vibrant sisterhood of women dedicated to musical excellence in performance of four-part a cappella harmony, barbershop style.  We enrich the lives of our members and communities through education, creative entertainment, and competition.

name: Heart of America Chorus
missionStatement: Drawn by Harmony, Bound by Friendship, Striving for Excellence!

name: Light of Hope Congregation
missionStatement: The Salvation Choir is a Congolese Rumba band from Congo and Tanzania based in Kansas City, Missouri. With over 20-some members, the multigenerational group features family members and friends who immigrated to the midwest from Congo and Tanzania. Their exuberant sound is a blend of Congolese rumba, Seben/Soukous, and African gospel music.

name: Fountain City Performing Arts
missionStatement: The organization's mission is to create artistry through aspiration and activism towards social justice.

name: St. Joseph Youth Chorale
missionStatement: ​​SJYC is an educational non-profit dedicated to the promotion of advanced  choral education experiences for exceptional singers in grades 2-12 in St. Joseph, Missouri, and surrounding communities. The organization offers a home for young singers, years of experience, and a brilliant, shining passion for their art in their mission to support gifted young singers and their local community.

name: St. Joseph Community Chorus
missionStatement: The mission of St. Joseph Community Chorus is to foster the enjoyment and appreciation of good choral music among its membership and the community at large by providing an organization of the highest musical caliber to present quality performances of choral literature. The chorus presents interesting, challenging and diverse programs of choral music from the classical to contemporary throughout the Midwestern United States.
